heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: The last storm was on 13 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.6°C), outside temperature (down 1.9°C), and inside temperature (down 1.6°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 152 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 2.9°C), cloud levels (up 337 m), and inside temperature (up 2.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 151.7m higher than yesterday, 61.6m lower than the past week, 336.5m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 926m to 1357m and averaged 1236.8m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and winds will be practically absent. Showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and the light is absent. Weather should be calm and steady.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
